snippet: As the number of diagnoses in California reached 59, some schools said students may be barred because they have not been inoculated.
abstract: Health officials say 59 cases of measles have been diagnosed in California from outbreak that started at Disneyland; unvaccinated students in Orange County may be prevented from attending school; debate over childhood vaccinations heats up.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and ABBY GOODNOUGH
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Abby Goodnough from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As the number of diagnoses in California reached 59, some schools said students may be barred because they have not been inoculated.

headline.main: Measles Cases Linked to Disneyland Rise, and Debate Over Vaccinations Intensifies
headline.print_headline: Measles Cases Linked to Disneyland Rise, and Debate Over Vaccinations Intensifies
